commentBody:
I wish that the Judiciary Committee would put these hearings off until after the Holidays.  I also wish that everyone would stop giving so much weight to the public opinion pools.  They have rarely been accurate.

The Judiciary Committee should focus on one thing only.  To do the right thing.  Maybe they should concentrate on having the Capitol Police arrest all those who refused to testify at the behest of Trump.  If that isn't a case for Obstruction of Justice, I don't know what is.  

In any case, Trump has proven in his own words that he did have a quid pro quo in mind and in fact.  How much more black and white does something have to be before he is iImpeached?

By the way, it isn't the Impeachment process that is dividing our country.  It is the collective closed minds of Republicans and the power structure that has caused it.  Impeachment of Trump will not be what keeps our Country divided.  It is the GOP and its minions.

What is keeping our Country divided is its persistent inequality in 
our Country from gerrymandering to Voter suppression, to lack of choice and upside down economics, including the Tax Reform Bill, and the continued lack of Separation of Church and State.  
Until these problems are taken care of, we will remain divided.

Clear and accurate.', 'createDate': '1575299363', 'updateDate': '1575318395', 'approveDate': '1575300617', 'recommendations': 16, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103922798, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jean', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103924449', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 103925448, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103925448, 'userID': 72899321, 'userDisplayName': 'edTow', 'userLocation': 'Bklyn', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Jean 
Your summary is stirring, but there's one giant problem with it -

"Upside down economics" - yes, very real and exacerbated almost daily for 3 years - would SEEM INEVITABLY destined to shatter Trump's coalition of wealthy folks who could care less about things like "an opioid crisis" or attacks on freedom of choice re pregnancy... and the much less privileged folks in Michigan, Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, etc. who brought Trump to power.

And it obviously has NOT achieved that. Our only hope - and it's starting to look out of reach - is that the white suburban women in those states basically look themselves in the mirror and ask, "WHAT AM I if I vote for DJT... again?!"

In short - we've blown our responsibility to educate our citizenry!

Somehow, we've gone from a time when people had the smarts to distinguish between pols who "mostly" were in their corner from the ones looking to gut them... to NOW, when there ARE millions of Americans who think that the greatest danger to our country is at our southern border.

I kinda get the chaos re Britain and Brexit, but for the U.S. to have elected a man who fabricated "thousands of rapists" looking to immigrate here... and then campaigned successfully on "build a wall" can only be explained by the kind of ignorance and mis-education that was the subject of a court case a year or 2 back.

And those same schools and teachers must be doing a bad job teaching "judge people by their actions - not by the color of their skin!"', 'createDate': '1575302886', 'updateDate': '1575538042', 'approveDate': '1575303910', 'recommendations': 7, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103922798, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jean', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103925448', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 103925527, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103925527, 'userID': 44408371, 'userDisplayName': 'Nyalman', 'userLocation': 'New York', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': 'Basically until everyone adopts my “progressive” values we will be divided. I don't love it either but them's the rules, and for good reason.", 'createDate': '1575309153', 'updateDate': '1575315326', 'approveDate': '1575314343', 'recommendations': 1, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103922798, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jean', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103927392', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 103928728, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103928728, 'userID': 81131813, 'userDisplayName': 'Tom', 'userLocation': 'Austin', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Nyalman 

Exactly the divisive rhetoric used by the right that she is talking about.  You just played right into what she was saying.

It's about rule of law and the constitution.  Do you believe everyone should have an equal opportunity to vote no matter their race, gender, social status, or proximity to a polling station?

Do you believe that every vote in a state should count equally to another vote in that state, regardless of the neighborhood they live in?

Do you believe that we should pass major tax legislation with bipartisan support rather than down slim party lines?

(before you get started on the ACA, recall that it was a Republican idea first, and that it was opposed by Republicans just because it was called "Obamacare" and not "Romneycare")

Why don't we work together on the things we can agree on, and why can't you see that one side is clearly gaming the system for their party and not the US as a whole?

What exactly have Democrats done to make you and other conservatives so upset?  Supported same sex marriage and abortion laws upheld by the SC?  Last time I checked, Obama was President for 8 years and everyone still has their guns.  People are getting killed every day by them.

The economy was way better after Obama than it was before him, record setting job growth nearly his entire two terms.  

Seriously, what is the problem?  Why fight progressives so much?
